intro: Stellera thesioides, commonly known as mountain sandwort, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of North America. It belongs to the family Capparaceae and is characterized by its dense, mat-forming growth habit. The plant features small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are alternate, linear, and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are often prostrate or ascending. Stellera thesioides thrives in well-drained, rocky soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine habitats.
